results.title: City out of time
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Venice that expores the rich legacy of art bequeathed to all. Two hundred years ago Canaletto caught its elusive beauty, and in this film details of his pictures rise before you - spired churches and turreted palaces soar into a blue Mediterranean sky. Narrated by William Shatner. (Award: Vancouver)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: City of God = Cidade de Deus
results.creator_credit: Fernando Meirelles, Mauricio Andrade Ramos, Andrea Barata Ribeiro, VideoFilmes Production and O2 Filmes
results.brief_description: Award winning cinema, this directorial masterpiece by Fernando Meirelles is violent, disturbing and skillful storytelling. The story unfolds in the slums of Rio de Janeiro’s “City of God”, a housing project built in the 1960s that becomes by the ‘80s a city engulfed by gang warfare. Based on a true story and a novel by Paulo Lins, young Busca-Pe (aka Rocket) grows up amongst this violence and we learn the history of the gangs through a series of stories told in flashback style with him as narrator. Rocket, through all of the horror, decides his own fate by becoming a photographer and his ability is his way out of the ‘City’. Gangsters, guns and violence are so accepted that they become the norm to a new and much younger generation happy to perpetuate the lifestyle learned from birth, reinforced by poverty. Nominated for four Academy Awards. In Portuguese with English subtitles. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: City on fire
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam and Media Asia Distribution
results.brief_description: Charismatic Hong Kong film star Chow Yun Fat stars in Ringo Lam’s explosive action film about an undercover cop whose investigation into a series of jewelery robberies around Hong Kong draws him into a dangerous circle of new friends. He becomes buddies with a member of this gang (Danny Lee) and is soon involved in the gang’s next big heist. This is a classic example of the Hong Kong action film genre. (Awards: Winner of Best Director and Best Actor at the 7th Annual Hong Kong Film Awards) In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: City limits
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Forthright, critical analysis of the problems of North American cities by Jane Jacobs, authority and author of books and articles on the subject. A former New Yorker, she chose to live in Toronto because “it is a city that still has options…it hasn’t made so many mistakes that it’s bound to go downhill.” Her remarks, and what this film shows, will interest all civic and community groups - in fact, all urban dwellers. Photography by Jacques Fogel, Albert Kish, Cameron Gaul, Raymond Dumas.

results.title: City family
results.creator_credit: Richard Moir, Chris McGill, Donald Crombie and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Depicts a working day and evening and a holiday in the life of an average Sydney suburban family, set against a musical background of Debussy piano pieces.

results.title: City in the sun
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Loch and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Inspired by Arne Sucksdorff’s “Manniskor i Stad” (Rhythm of a city), this film reflects the mood of a day in the life of Sydney, New South Wales, from morning until night.

results.title: City girl
results.brief_description: Anne (Laura Harrington) is a photographer trying to advance her career taking snaps of high profile people in compromising situations. While working on a futuristic fashion shoot, she makes friends with two of the models, Gracie and Sugar, who also happen to dabble in prostitution on the side. Gracie particularly catches Anne’s interest when it is revealed that she has been in a relationship with Champagne Sam, one of the city’s most notorious pimps. Anne soon breaks up with her boyfriend, Joey (Joe Mastroianni), and starts leading the high life, frequenting strip clubs with her friends, and pursuing unsatisfactory relationships with a number of different men. However, Anne’s new-found freedom comes at a price; her latest photographic assignment turns into a nightmare when Champagne Sam, whom she was secretly photographing for an assignment, discovers that she has been hiding Gracie, and ransacks her apartment. Suddenly Anne realises how close she has come to total disaster. But has she realised too late?

results.title: Citizen Kane (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Orson Welles and Mercury Productions
results.brief_description: A faceless journalist sets out to investigate the life of media magnate and failed politician Charles Foster Kane. He seeks to uncover the meaning of “rosebud”, Kane’s last utterance. In turn satire, tragedy and gothic comedy, Citizen Kane is a triumph of disjointed, non-linear narrative in which the form becomes the theme, an ironic reflection upon the success ethic and the crushing weight of materialism. In drawing upon the tradition of classical narrative, while at the same time violating some of the expectations in the viewer’s reception of such narrative, Welles ultimately assured “Citizen Kane” of its place as a watershed in modern cinema. Credits: script-Herman J. Mankiewicz, Orson Welles; music-Bernard Hermann; photography-Gregg Toland; editors-Robert Wise, Mark Robson. Cast includes: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Agnes Moorehead, Dorothy Comingore, Ray Collins, Everett Sloane.

results.title: Citizen Kane
results.brief_description: Shrouded in darkness and fog is the huge mansion called Xanadu. We pass through the iron gates which forbid our entry and approach the grotesque structure. In a dark room, an old man, the master of the extravagant folly, lies dying. As his life ebbs away, a crystal ball containing a snow scene crashes to the floor and is shattered. He utters one plaintive whisper “Rosebud”. Now we are beginning one of the most fantastic experiences of all time - the masterpiece and first feature written, produced and directed by Orson Welles. Rated: PG

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: David Hughes, Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.
